alert.note: Alert for Chickasaw (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 25 at 12:40PM CST until further notice by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of North Mississippi, including the following counties, Chickasaw and Monroe. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1240 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Amory, Aberdeen, Okolona, Smithville, New Wren, Prairie, Trebloc, Nettleton, Hatley, Gattman, East Aberdeen, Becker, Wren, Bigbee, Binford, Quincy, New Hamilton, Wise Gap, Athens and Greenwood Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
